definitions.text: a contest with rules to determine a winner
examples: you need four people to play this game

definitions.text: a single play of a sport or other contest

examples: he thought of his painting as a game that filled his empty time
his life was all fun and games

definitions.text: animal hunted for food or sport
(tennis) a division of play during which one player serves
(games) the score at a particular point or the score needed to win
examples: he is serving for the game

definitions.text: the flesh of wild animals that is used for food
a secret scheme to do something (especially something underhand or illegal)
examples: they concocted a plot to discredit the governor
I saw through his little game from the start

definitions.text: the game equipment needed in order to play a particular game
examples: the child received several games for his birthday

definitions.text: your occupation or line of work

examples: for actors, memorizing lines is no game
for him, life is all fun and games
I'm betting on the new horse

definitions.text: disabled in the feet or legs
